channel.title: 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command..help
channel.description:
wat do i do here?
'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .
its proboly an easy thing to fix but iv never had this prob

item.title: 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command..help
item.dc:creator: @Merked_You Merked You
item.description:
@Merked_You wrote:

[quote=“zammy!!, post:1, topic:59344”]wat do i do here?

‘java’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
Press any key to continue . . .

its proboly an easy thing to fix but iv never had this prob[/quote]

I thought you was fooling around when you posted this in your other thread lol.

But check if you got the latest java download, could be the problem.

Read full topic
item.source: 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command..help

item.title: 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command..help
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

wow, this is kinda noobish, i better take this step by step.

1 open your source file
2 find compile.bat and right (->) click
3 click edit
4 replace the text with this

[code]@echo off

title go to geocities.com/blahbah7 for blahbah7’s server

title Compiling…
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java

title Starting YOURSERVERNAME…
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0\bin\java.exe” server[/code]
5 save and exit
6 right (->) click on runserver.bat
7 click edit
8 replace text with this

@echo off title Runserver set java="C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\java.exe" java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server pause
9 save and exit
10 run compile.bat
11 i really hope u kno wht to do from here

Read full topic
